snippet: The smallest of the Big Four cellphone carriers has stepped away from the two-year, unbreakable contract that Sprint, Verizon and AT&T live by, David Pogue writes in Thursday’s New York Times.
abstract: The smallest of the Big Four cellphone carriers has stepped away from the two-year, unbreakable contract that Sprint, Verizon and AT&T live by, David Pogue writes in Thursday’s New York Times.

headline.main: T-Mobile Breaks Free of the Cellphone Carrier Conspiracy
